newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea to supply 1.5 trln won to financial system.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea to supply 1.5 trln won to financial system.

text.p: South Korea's finance ministry said on Thursday it would supply 1.5 trillion won to banks and merchant banks to ease tightening liquidity as a result of troubles with the Kia Group.
The money will be distributed between July 28 and August 11 from the state budget.
A ministry official said one trillion won would be funneled into banks and another 500 billion won to merchant banks.
The money will carry a 10 percent interest rate.
Distribution of the money will be dependent on the financial institutions' exposure to the Kia Group and the group's subcontractors.
